result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan L Brogaard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-03-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan L Brogaard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan L Brogaard in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Jonathan L Brogaard in custody.  Daniel Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO THE PENALTY ENHANCER:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the penalty enhancer, 'Use of a Dangerous Weapon', stricken from the record.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  court sentenced defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 36 days served.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-03-2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jonathan L Brogaard not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.  Bail to remain the same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Demand For Discovery And Inspection filed by Attorney Thomas E. Harris.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Jonathan L Brogaard not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjournment of the bail hearing heard and granted.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with FRANK S.; CAPRI L. AND HER RESIDENCE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan L Brogaard in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Jonathan L Brogaard in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
